We are talking about like fantastic numbers, like almost 30% of all ETH is staked at the moment. It is much more important to have this independent entities. And even if we would see like a very low percentage of stake being allocated to a significant amount of solo stakers, it would mean that the network itself is made out of multiple participants. And even though their weights in stake are different from the practical perspective. Let's take censorship resistance as an example. If this 5% are not censoring transactions, it would mean that some transactions would take longer to pass, but they would pass and even this 5% would be enough. Even if their stake shares are not that significant, but they still run their full nodes which would allow for the network recovery way faster.
